nodes.label: Autonomous Navigation
nodes.description: Systems enabling robots to navigate and move in environments without human intervention, using sensor data and path planning algorithms.

nodes.label: LiDAR
nodes.description: Light Detection and Ranging sensor that measures distances using laser light, creating detailed 3D maps of surroundings.

nodes.label: SLAM
nodes.description: Simultaneous Localization and Mapping - technique for robots to build a map while tracking their position within that map.

nodes.label: Computer Vision
nodes.description: Field enabling machines to interpret and understand visual information from the world, essential for object recognition and scene understanding.

nodes.label: ROS
nodes.description: Robot Operating System - flexible framework for writing robot software, providing tools and libraries for robot applications.

nodes.label: Actuators
nodes.description: Components that convert energy into motion, enabling robots to move and interact with their environment.

nodes.label: Machine Learning
nodes.description: AI technique enabling robots to learn from data and improve performance without explicit programming.

nodes.label: IMU
nodes.description: Inertial Measurement Unit - measures acceleration, rotation, and magnetic fields to determine orientation and movement.

nodes.label: Path Planning
nodes.description: Algorithms that compute optimal or feasible paths for robots to move from one position to another while avoiding obstacles.

nodes.label: Robotic Arm
nodes.description: Mechanical arm with multiple joints, enabling precise manipulation of objects in industrial and service applications.

nodes.label: Depth Camera
nodes.description: Camera that captures depth information, providing 3D understanding of scenes for navigation and manipulation.

nodes.label: Industrial Automation
nodes.description: Use of robots in manufacturing and industrial processes to increase efficiency, precision, and safety.

nodes.label: Autonomous Vehicles
nodes.description: Self-driving vehicles that use sensors and AI to navigate roads without human intervention.

nodes.label: Reinforcement Learning
nodes.description: Machine learning approach where agents learn optimal behaviors through trial and error and reward signals.

nodes.label: Drones/UAVs
nodes.description: Unmanned Aerial Vehicles capable of autonomous or remote-controlled flight for various applications.

nodes.label: Object Detection
nodes.description: Computer vision technique to identify and locate objects within images or video streams.

nodes.label: Robotic Grasping
nodes.description: Techniques enabling robots to pick up and manipulate objects of various shapes and materials.

nodes.label: Control Systems
nodes.description: Systems that manage robot behavior and ensure desired performance through feedback and regulation.

nodes.label: Medical Robotics
nodes.description: Robots used in healthcare for surgery, rehabilitation, and patient care, enhancing precision and outcomes.

nodes.label: Force/Torque Sensors
nodes.description: Sensors measuring forces and torques applied to robot components, crucial for safe interaction and manipulation.

nodes.label: Neural Networks
nodes.description: Deep learning models inspired by biological neurons, used for perception, decision-making, and control.

nodes.label: Warehouse Automation
nodes.description: Automated systems for storage, retrieval, and movement of goods in warehouses and distribution centers.

nodes.label: Servo Motors
nodes.description: Precision motors with feedback control, essential for accurate positioning in robotic joints.

nodes.label: Semantic Segmentation
nodes.description: Computer vision task of classifying each pixel in an image, enabling detailed scene understanding.

nodes.label: Collision Avoidance
nodes.description: Algorithms that detect and prevent collisions between robots and obstacles or other agents.
